text: Democratic societies are run and governed by
explanation: Democratic societies are governed by laws rather than monarchs, passion, or charisma. Laws provide a structured and formal system of rules that ensure fairness  and order, essential for democratic governance.

text: To guarantee the rights and freedom of citizens . The powers of the organs of government must be.
explanation: To guarantee the right and freedom of citizens, the power of the organs of government must be separated. This principle, known as the separation of powers, prevents any branch of government from becoming too powerful and protects individual freedoms.

text: Which of the following is an example of inalienable rights?
explanation: Inalienable rights are fundamental rights that cannot be taken away or surrendered. The right to life is considered an inalienable right because it is fundamental to the existence of individuals, unlike rights such as voting or social security, which can vary by country and circumstances.

text: Citizenship can be acquired through
explanation: Citizenship  can be acquired through registration ,which is a formal process of enrolling oneself as a citizen .Nationalization and decree are not commonly used method for acquiring citizenship in a standard context

text: Which of the following right cannot be enjoyed by an  Italian citizen that is residing in a  West African country
explanation: an Italian citizen residing in West  African country would typically not have the right to vote in that country's election,as voting right are generally limited to the citizens of the country where the election takes place

text: One of the outstanding features of citizenship by birth is that

options.D: it can be reverted to alien status

explanation: citizenship by birth is generally considered to be permanent and cannot be forfeited .it is a fundamental aspect of an individuals identity and status in a country

text: in order to reduce over-reliance  on foreign grants, civil society organizations need to

options.B: become more national in their spread and membership
options.C: engage in more pragmatic methods like lobbying

explanation: To reduce over-reliance on foreign grants, civil society organizations need to create revenue generation activities. This approach helps them become more self-sufficient and less dependent on external funding.

text: The major constraint to national development
explanation: A major constraint to national development is a high level of nepotism. Nepotism can lead to the appointment of unqualified individuals to positions of power, hindering effective governance and development.

text: The conduct of an election in a democracy is the responsibility of .
explanation: The conduct of an election in a democracy is the responsibility of the electoral commission. This independent body is tasked with organizing and overseeing elections to ensure they are free and fair.

text: Accepting other people's opinions and preferences, even when they live in a way one does not agree with defines
explanation: Tolerance is the acceptance of others' opinions and preferences, even when they differ from one's beliefs. It involves respecting diversity and coexisting peacefully with people who have different lifestyles or views.

text: Civil society organizations fight poverty by

options.C: providing arena for the expression of diverse interest

explanation: Civil society organizations fight poverty by strengthening good governance.  Effective governance ensures that resources are used efficiently and that polices are implemented to benefit the wider community.

text: The constitution is important because it

options.A: allows government institutions to act anyhow
options.B: enables a particular ethnic group to control the government
options.C: is applicable to the president only

explanation: The constitution is important because it regulates all citizens. It establishes the fundamental laws and principles governing a country, ensuring that everyone is subject to the same legal standards

text: Which of the following does a civil society advocate for

options.A: subjective criticism of government policies and programmes
options.B: emergence of dictatorship and political extremism.
options.C: violent demonstration to express views or positions
options.D: objectivity and respect for opposing views

explanation: A civil society advocate for objectivity and respect for opposing views, this approach promotes constructive dialogue and helps ensure that diverse perspectives are considered in policy making

text: A responsible citizen can show loyalty and devotion to his country by

options.B: Reporting any bad act of sabotage.

explanation: A responsible citizen can show loyalty and devotion to their country by reporting any act of sabotage. Reporting such activities helps protect the countys integrity and security.

text: Violations of traffic codes are often dealt with by.
explanation: Violation of traffic codes are often dealt with by forfeiting a fine. This financial penalty serves as a deterrent and encourages compliance with traffic regulations.

text: Civil society is regarded as an important organ of the society because it

options.A: involves the operation of the government
options.B: takes a position on important policy questions.
options.C: represents the interests of powerful groups
options.D: improves the generality of citizens' well-being.

explanation: Civil society is regarded as an important organ of society because it takes position on important policy questions. It plays a crucial role in advocating for public interests and holding the government accountable.

text: Building national values and ethical cultures can be hindered by.

options.A: Celebrating the right people by media or society

explanation: Building national culture and ethical culture can be hindered by poor citizenship or followership when citizens do not actively engage in ethical behavior or contribute to society, it undermines the development of strong values

text: Establishment, maintenance and regulation of slaughterhouses and slabs is the statutory role of.
explanation: The establishment, maintenance, and regulation of slaughterhouses and slabs is typically the responsibility of the local government. local authorities such services and facilities within their jurisdiction.

text: Public servants are directly  responsible for the poor quality of service delivery due to
explanation: Public servants are directly responsible for the poor quality of service delivery due to poor condition of service. Inadequate resources and poor working conditions can lead to substandard performance

text: Which of the following defines a legal member of a state
explanation: A legal member of a state is defined as a citizen. .citizenship denotes a formal and legal status within a country, conferring rights and responsibilities.

text: Constant appreciation of children by parents
explanation: Constant appreciation of children by parents builds strong and confident children. Positive reinforcement helps children develop self-esteem and a sense of security

text: An individual who abuses drugs will experience the following except
explanation: An individual who abuses drugs will not experience a healthy immune system. drug abuse typically results to negative health effects, including withdrawal,depression, and potential traces of  insanity

text: A right to rule based on the recognition of personal  qualities is known as
explanation: The right to rule based on personal qualities is known as charisma authority. This type of authority is based on the personal charm or appeal of a leader, rather than a legal or traditional grounds

text: The Universal Declaration of Human Rights [UDHR] was proclaimed by the United Nations
explanation: The Universal Declaration of Human Rights [UDHR] was proclaimed by the United Nations General Assembly. This body represents all member states and is responsible for adopting  important international documents

text: Dependency on foreign donors by civil society organizations primarily

options.A: promote a long-term strategy of chasing funds
options.B: distracts the organization from their missions

explanation: dependency on foreign donors by civil society organizations can primarily distract the organization from their missions. Over-resilience on external funds can shift focus away from core objectives

text: The right to work in any part in any part of the country can be regarded as
explanation:
The right to work in any part of the country is regarded as a civic right. Civic rights pertain to the right of citizens to participate in the social and economic life of their country
.

text: Political participation can be limited by
explanation: Political participation can be limited by wealth. individual with limited financial resources may find it challenging to engage fully in political activities due to barriers such as campaign costs

text: One of the roles of the police as an important pillar of democracy is

options.B: guarding and protecting sensitive election materials
options.D: helping the incumbent government to continue in office

explanation: one of the roles of police in a democracy is to guard and protect sensitive election material. This ensures the integrity  and security of the electoral process

text: Which of the following institutions was set up to address the unfair treatment of citizens by public servants?
explanation: The Public Complaint Commission /Ombudsman was set up to address unfair treatment of citizens by public servants. This institution investigates complaints and ensures accountability.

text: Some civil society organizations do not get the needed attention from the government because of
explanation: Some civil society organizations do not get the needed attention from the government because of confrontation in some sensitive issues. this can lead to strained relationship with government bodies

text: The reasons the seven core freedoms of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights [UDHR] are so important is because of

options.A: they concern individuals directly and influence their peaceful existence as human being
options.B: the violation of one right often leads to the violation of another right
options.C: they embody key values and the rights of human beings
options.D: They enable individuals to speak up and challenge poor treatment from a public authority

explanation: The seven core freedoms of the UDHR  are important because they concern individuals directly and influence their' peaceful existence as human beings. these freedoms are fundamental to ensuring human dignity and peace

text: The roles of individuals in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights [UDHR] include

options.A: incorporation of UDHR into the national constitution
options.B: Enacting laws that promote the objectives of UDHR
options.C: tolerance of other people's views, opinions, beliefs, etc
options.D: carrying out advocacy programs through the mass media

explanation: the role of individuals in the UDHR includes tolerance of other people's views, opinions, and beliefs. This fosters a respectful and inclusive environment in society

text: Bureaucracy in public service simply means
explanation: Bureaucracy in a public service often refers to red-tapism, which involves excessive adherence to rules and formalities, potentially causing delays and inefficiencies

text: Constant changes in public service has led to
explanation: Constant changes of  public servants can lead to the abandonment of many projects Frequent shifts in policy or leadership may disrupt ongoing initiatives and lead to incomplete or neglected project

text: The rule of law requires that

options.A: The government should be subject to the law
options.B: the law should be subject to the government
options.C: law should be made in respect of individuals
options.D: the law should be subject to traditional rulers

explanation: The rule of law requires that government should be subject to the law. These principles, including government officials, are accountable under the law

text: Youth empowerment programs aimed at giving the youth the opportunity to
explanation: Youth empowerment programs are aimed at giving the youth the opportunity to be self-sufficient. These programs focus on equipping  young people with skills and resources to become independent and productive members of society

text: To end the compulsive behavior of drug addiction, drug addict

options.C: can relocate to a new environment
options.D: should take a lesser dosage of drugs

explanation: To end the compulsive behavior of drug addiction, drug addicts need support and treatment. Professional help and support systems are essential for recovering and overcoming addiction

text: One can support a person with substance abuse problem by

options.C: Taking over the drug user responsibilities
options.D: covering up or making excuses for the drug abuser

explanation: One can support a person with a constant abuse problem through counseling and rehabilitation. these methods provide the necessary support and treatment for recovery

text: Trafficked persons are mainly lured with a promise of
explanation: Trafficked persons are often lured with the promise of employment. traffickers exploit  the promises of job opportunities to deceive and coerce individuals into a trafficking situation

text: A major source of funds to local government authorities is
explanation: A major source of funds to local government authorities is taxes on goods. These taxes provide revenue for local government to fund public services and infrastructure

text: Which of the following is the key factor in fostering cooperation among members of the society
explanation: The key factor in fostering cooperation among members of society is understanding. Understanding others' perspectives and needs facilitates effective collaboration and mutual support

text: Which of the  immune system cells does HIV target or attack
explanation: HIV primarily targets and attacks T-cells, which are a type of white blood cell crucial for the immune system. The destruction of these cells impairs the body's ability to fight infection

text: Values are what we?

options.D: known as an agent of civic education

explanation: Values are what we believe and imbibe. They represent fundamental beliefs and principles that guide behavior and decisions

text: One of the citizenship values included by parent into their children includes
explanation: One of the citizenship values included by parents into their children is fairness to all. Teaching children to be fair and just is essential for fostering good citizenship

text: The boldness to be honest in persecution is a manifestation of?
explanation: The boldness to be honest in persecution is a manifestation of courage, Courage involves standing up for one's beliefs and values even in the face of adversity

text: Civic education is also called
explanation: Civic education is also called citizenship education. This term emphasizes the role of education in preparing individuals to participate effectively in their communities and democracies.

text: Which of the following is not an agent of civic education
explanation: The Ministry of Labour and Productivity is not typically considered an agent of civic education. Agents of civic education include family, media, and peer pressure groups

text: The fundamental agent in children's guidance, training, and education is?
explanation: the fundamental agent in  guidance, training, and education is the parent. parent plays a crucial role in shaping their children's values and behavior from an early age

text: The most common method of acquiring the citizenship of a country is by
explanation: The most common method of acquiring the citizenship of a country is  by birth

text: The qualities of being fair and reasonable in the way that people are treated is known as
explanation: The qualities of being fair and reasonable in the way that people are treated is known as justice. justice ensures that individuals are treated fairly and equitably, according to established laws and standards
